intro: Narcissus bulbocodium var. paucinervis, commonly known as the slender-leaved daffodil, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and delicate yellow flowers. The plant produces a single, trumpet-shaped bloom with six petals, typically emerging in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to botanical collections.
